Transform Rules: HTTP Request/Response Header Modification
Rate Limiting Rules use 'ratelimit' action
Page Rules (legacy) — prefer newer Rules products
Worker snippets for complex logic
Zone ID and API Token required for API/Terraform deployment
XML format — all changes inside <configuration><system.webServer>
URL Rewrite module required for path-based rules
HTTP Headers via <httpProtocol><customHeaders>
Request Filtering via <security><requestFiltering>
Directory browsing via <directoryBrowse enabled='false' />
Method filtering via <verbs> section
Restart IIS Application Pool after changes (iisreset or App Pool recycle)
Caddyfile uses site block syntax: example.com { ... }
Named matchers: @name { path /... } then use respond @name 403
header directive for adding/removing response headers
respond directive for blocking with status code
reverse_proxy for proxy-level rules
Run 'caddy validate' before 'caddy reload'
No semicolons — newline-terminated directives
